alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 3:18PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cave Creek in the Chiricahua Mountains into Portal in the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Rapid rises in Cave Creek are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over the headwaters of Cave Creek with current estimates around 1.50 inches. Rain continues to fall over the area with up to an additional inch possible. This will cause small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cave Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Areas along Cave Creek through Portal. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
